General scheme of the terpene synthesis pathways in plants and their inhibitors. ABA:
abscisic acid. CLO: clomazone. DMAPP: isomer dimethylallyl diphosphte. DXP: 1-deoxy-
5-phosphate. DXR: DXP reductoisomerase. DXS: DXP synthase. FPP: farnesyl diphosphate. FSM:
3-hydroxy-3-methylglutaryl-coenzyme A. HMGR: HMG-CoAreductase. IPP: isopentenyl diphosphate.
The MVApathway is primarily regulated at the level of the 3-hydroxy-3-methylglutaryl-coenzyme
], and it is known that HMGR activity regulates the metabolic
ﬂux through the MVA pathway and the eventual production of the isoprenoid end-products [
The scenario seems to be more complex in the case of the MEP pathway. In fact, the MEP pathway can
be regulated by several enzymes, including 1-deoxy-
Generally, it is assumed that the MVA pathway is responsible for providing precursors for
the synthesis of sesquiterpenes and triterpenes, while the MEP pathway donates precursors for
]. Although both pathways are thought to operate
independently under normal conditions, interactions between themhave been repeatedly reported [
Thus, experiments with labelled products and/or treatments with speciﬁc inhibitors (mevinoline and
fosmidomycin that respectively block the MVA and MEP pathways) illustrate that the compartmental
division between the two pathways is not complete since common metabolites fromboth pathways can
be exchanged, in both directions, through the plastidial membrane [
contribution of the MVA and MEP pathways for the biosynthesis of plant terpenes and the factors
controlling this distribution especially under physiological conditions of growing plants remain
uncertain for each plant species. It is still assumed, however, that monoterpenes are primarily
synthesized in the plastids via the MEP pathway-derived IPP and DMAPP [
Medicus) is an aromatic shrub of high economic importance due
to its essential oil, composed mainly of monoterpenes [
]. The main constituents in spike lavender
oil from flowers are the monoterpenes linalool, cineole and camphor, while the main constituents
